comments.text:
There already is a kill all command:
/kill @e But that kills all entities and players.
/kill @a This kills all players
/kill @e[type=!Player] This kills all entities and no players
/kill PlayerNameHere This kills a certain player.
/kill @e[type=MobHere] This kills all of a certain mob but it has to start 
with a capital eg: Pig, Squid, Zombie. But some mobs require a weird name 
eg: EntityHorse, WitherBoss, Ozelot.
/kill @e[r=RadiusNumberHere] This kills all entities in a certain radius, 
also works with @a.
/kill @e[r=5,type=Cow] They can be stacked.

There is even more but I won't go into them.
Search it up. Hope this helps!

top_comment.text:
As someone who has personally encountered Herobrine. I disagree. If anyone 
has time for a story feel free to read but if not just go on with your day.

So i was in my minecraft world. it was titled DubbaWUbbaSHubbaGRubba. I was 
bored when making it. Anyway i had a pet wolf and a cat outside my home 
incase of creepers.  One day i went out to go get some food. I normally 
make hunting runs every once in a while and bring back a lot of food and 
put it in a chest. Well my food supply was low so i went out to go get 
more. Bringing the last of the food with me.
Anyway, I saw a mountain top and me. Not knowing that mobs wouldn't render 
from that far away. decided to climb it and look around for some cows or 
pigs. Now when i got to the top anyone who plays minecraft knows the mobs 
wouldn't render so naturally i saw nothing. I span in a slow circle on the 
mountaintop scanning for food. When i saw him. This was a singleplayer game 
no brothers trolling no lan connection. offline mode. I just stared at him 
for the longest time. I had heard about it but never thought it was real. 
It was already there before i had reached the top of the mountain waiting 
for me. and it stared. for what seemed like hours i just looked at it 
trying to figure out how to take a screenshot. When it despawned like a mob 
would when you get too far away. I have never seen it from that day. but i 
have lost far to many wolves in the forest i saw him in.﻿

comments.text:
Well the South Park episode in the end actually showed why it became such a 
popular game and it is in essence the same reason why Legos are such a 
popular toy. In the end only limited to ones imagination. For some that is 
all that is needed for others they enjoy preset stuff which is why many 
servers have plugins and such for different types of games. From Hunger 
Games to Pixelmon (pokemon mod for minecraft) to even Props and Goat 
Simulator. Minecraft essentially hit a market that nothing else had been 
able to and that is peoples imagination. Java programmers can make mods and 
plugins for it allowing more and more stuff to be added, in fact many 
things in minecraft such as pistons, horses, slime blocks, all started off 
as mods before being implemented into the actual game. It is the same 
reason why games such as the Elder Scroll Series on the PC stays popular 
for so long is because of user created content. There is always something 
new to do with new mods making the game essentially never having a true 
ending unlike consoles in which games eventually die because no more 
support from the publisher/developer.

I seen herobrine with my friend in a private world. I didn't have a camera 
or a recorder so people think i don't have a evidence about him. but at

something about don't touch my stuff or i will kill u. I said pfft yea

it was the 3rd sign when i saw a bunch of soul sand on fire and it says 
"this is your final warning beware" and something punch me lucky enough i 
didnt die. Then I turned around and my friend nots there anymore I thought 
It was him then I went to the 4th sign and it says "You have been warned" 
or something like that Idk i forgot it it was 2012 alright! Then something 
punch me there was a canyon near the sign so i almost fell down but luckily

friend was lost somewhere but he wasnt near the house he was lost.Remember 
this was December 23,2012 ﻿

top_comment.text:
Actually the creeper was made after the plant Peat, also know as Sphagnum, 
it's a type of green and black moss, that would explain the creepers 
coloration. Does it explode?? you bet it does! To spread its spores, as 
with most mosses, Sphagnum disperses spores through the wind. To accomplish 
this, the capsule holding the spores builds up air pressure before 
rupturing and launching the spores high into the air. Its a method that's 
very similar to a pop gun, air being squeezed into a tight space, before 
erupting all at once. Hissing sound anyone?? Little pockets of air leek out 
just before the time of explosion. And even though this moss is one of the 
most primitive plants forms on Earth, it has one of the most sophisticated 
methods of launching these spores. It creates a vortex ring. Kind of like a 
smoke ring or a mushroom cloud. These vortex rings allows Peat to launch 
its spores at an incredible speed for such a small plant. ﻿

captions.text:
Minecraft actually began in the form of
another game titled RubyDung

not much is known about the game
other than that it was influenced by a

city-building freeware game called Dwarf
Fortress
while Notch was working on RubyDung he found another game titled Infiniminer

Infiniminer was an open source
multiplayer block-based sandbox
building and digging game

sharing many similar features with what
would later become Minecraft

the name Minecraft came about when a user
in an IRC chatroom with notch
suggested itbut originally Notch wanted to call it Minecraft: Order of the Stone

this is the first ever version and released
video of the game

then only titled as Cave Game only four
days later on May 17th 2009

the very first alpha version of the game
is released to the public

this image is believed to be the first
ever in game creation shared by a user
only 49 minutes after the game was released

and two and a half hours after release
the very first in-game sprite art in the

form of an 8-bit Mario was created and
shared

if you're even slightly involved in the
Minecraft gaming community it's very likely
you've heard about Herobrine

it's a creepypasta story about the
character in the game which looks
exactly like the protagonist Steve

with the exception of the eyes which are
completely white

different sources state that Herobrine either

the creeper is a very iconic creature in
Minecraft

but it was actually created by mistake the
creeper came about when the length and

height of a pig model was accidentally
inverted resulting in a tall midsection
with small legs

Notch liked the look of the model and added a
green texture to it

and so the creeper was born all the
creatures in the game

are genderless even the main
protagonists Steve is neither male or female

or both the name Steve was actually just
suggested as a joke by Notch

but the name stuck with players and has
been widely used ever since

if you want to be accurate Steve should
be referred to only as
The Player
